project.teaser: ROTATE's ambition is to tap the full potential of minerals extraction and processing in a sustainable and ecological way, developing the needed technologies and tools for achieving zero emissions and pollution for essential and critical raw materials obtention and ensuring a...
project.objective: ROTATE's ambition is to tap the full potential of minerals extraction and processing in a sustainable and ecological way, developing the needed technologies and tools for achieving zero emissions and pollution for essential and critical raw materials obtention and ensuring a circular approach by implementing mechanisms for waste valorisation in the context of industrial symbiosis, especially reusing waste as aggregates for the construction sector and also recovering secondary products. ROTATE'S GENERAL OBJECTIVE is to achieve a near zero emissions and pollution obtention of raw materials, providing new tools for the mining industry in its journey to a more sustainable and green mineral extraction. The solutions proposed in the project will allow to improve the cut-off grade while reducing the environmental footprint of the whole process. The pilot demonstrations in mineral deposits with different paragenetic (minerals occurring together in a rock, formed by the same genetic process during the same stage) profiles will ensure the replication of the technologies to a wide variety of mining sites. To ensure EU?s lead on Critical Raw Materials access, the project is structured in three main interconnected PILLARS providing technical solutions and three transversal FLOORS covering cross cutting issues, including clustering and social acceptance. A series of technical Project Results of Pillars [PRP] and Project Results of Floors [PRF] will be delivered within the ROTATE's framework. ROTATE's will deliver specific methods and/or technologies aiming to overcome the reluctance of social agents to the exploitation of CRM deposits thanks to the environmental impact reduction achieved. This will result in an increase of the CRM sites that could be exploited in a future, boosting the access of EU to strategic CRM and enabling the development of the Renewables, e-mobility and Defence & Space sectors.
project.title: CIRCULAR ECOLOGICAL ESSENTIAL & CRITICAL RAW MATERIALS
project.keywords: critical raw materials, valorisation, environmental assessment

result.title: Dissemination & Communication materials (1/3)
result.description: """Report will include the following communication materials: Project Identity: HQ professional logo, professional presentation template, rollup and brochure will explain the project concept. Digital brochures: about the products developed and the results obtained in the ROTATE Project to ensure their publicity and knowledge in the M&Q community, to disseminate and to promote the market uptake of the project tools/technologies developed. They will serve the purpose of reflecting the status of the project and to support the presentations at events and the individual meetings carried out. Digital newsletters: developed and sent by email, according to the needs of different stakeholders. They will also be publicised through companies and project webpages to have a further visibility. In addition, the project can be promoted in other partners’ newsletters such as ANEFActualidad or EUInsight. Promotional video: short video presenting the project and explaining its main goals and future results. Uploaded to the project website and published in other social media. During the project, 5 more videos created explaining the different results achieved"". (T7.2)."

result.title: Exposure Factors vs. Bioaccessibility in the Soil-and-Dust Ingestion Pathway: A Comparative Assessment of Uncertainties Using MC2D Simulations in an Arsenic Exposure Scenario

details.authors: F. Barrio-Parra, H. Serrano García, M. Izquierdo-Díaz & E. De Miguel

result.title: Data Management Plan - DMP (1/2)
result.description: 1st iteration of Consortium’s plan -incrementally developed- on the handling of research data during and after the end of the project: what data is collected, processed and/or generated, which methodology and standards are applied, whether data is to be shared or made open access and how data is curated and preserved. (T9.4)

result.title: Protocols to cooperate with RMIS & EURMKB
result.description: This deliverable will define the mechanism to provide/share the project´s outcomes to RMIS and EURMKB.It shall detail the protocol of cooperation with the European Commission’s Joint Research Center (JRC) as the center in charge of the RMIS development and maintenance, taking into account, that the availability, consistency, and longevity of EURMKB data and analyses, are facilitated by RMIS. The cooperation protocol will establish the procedure to be followed.(T8.4)

result.title: Communication with policy makers and evaluation (1/3)
result.description: Report including the main conclusions derived from the interaction with policy makers. (minutes of the meeting will be included).(T8.3)

result.title: Clustering plan
result.description: This deliverable will address three specific points: strategic analysis, strategic formulation, and strategy deployment. It will be defined for a temporary period of 4 years, grouping the strategic challenges in strategic lines. These lines will determine the concrete objectives on which the action and resources will be focused in order to achieve the challenges. Indicators appropriate to the complexity and multi-causality of the challenges will be selected to measure the achievements. The strategy deployment will include an action plan, the alignment of actions and challenges, and a roadmap that chronologically orders the actions. Control and monitoring will be carried out with the definition of KPIs (between 12 and 24). The KPIs will permit to know the effectiveness of the defined strategy, according to the degree of the execution of the actions and the achievement of the proposed objectives. (T8.4)

result.title: Preconcentration of a Medium-Grade Celestine Ore by Dense Medium Cyclone Using a Factorial Design

details.authors: Noemi Ariza-Rodríguez; Alejandro B. Rodríguez-Navarro; Francisco Ortega; Mónica Calero de Hoces; Mario J. Muñoz-Batista

result.title: Solutions for common mineral processes report (1/2)
result.description: This deliverable will detail the solutions developed for sustainable, safe and efficient extraction and treatment processes for energy, resources efficiency, emissions & pollution reduction and biodiversity management, rehabilitation and visual impacts reduction for the first 18 months of the project. These solutions will form the basis of the environmental risk prediction and management software module included in the environmental platform (M18). (T3.4)

details.authors: Yury Villagran-Zaccardi; Francisca Carreño; Line Granheim; Antonio Espín de Gea; Ulf Smith Minke; Stefania Butera; Elena López-Martínez; Arne Peys

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ROTATE (CIRCULAR ECOLOGICAL ESSENTIAL & CRITICAL RAW MATERIALS)
result.teaser: RM are key in industrial value chains; the EU heavily relies on imports. CRM suppliers are mainly in third countries, posing supply risks. With global shifts towards renewables and digitalization, RM and CRM demand will rise. EU must: Strengthen its value chain, diversify...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Social communication and participation strategy
result.description: This deliverable will define the communication and participation strategy that the project will follow to contact and stablish a continuous and bi-directional communication channel with local stakeholders. The deliverable will detail the main communication tools to be used, messages, a preliminary schedule for participation activities with local stakeholders and a set of indicators to evaluate the efficiency of the communication and participation strategy. (T8.1)

result.title: Screening-level ecological risk assessment (SLERA) in an abandoned As–Cu mining area (N Spain): implications of phyto-availability and soil properties on vegetation

details.authors: Humberto Serrano-García; Miguel Izquierdo-Díaz; Fernando Barrio-Parra; Rodrigo Álvarez; Almudena Ordóñez; Eduardo De Miguel

result.title: Requirements for the future (essential & CRM) projects integrated in the FPSC
result.description: This report will define the Requirements for the future (essential & CRM) projects integrated in the FPSC (T1.5) based on a preliminary survey and targeted individual meetings with a selection of partners, for the identification of their technological needs, social challenges, legal barriers, potential to reduce their environmental footprint and circularity challenges, priorities and proposed solutions & actions. This will allow to integrate individual inputs into the global strategy of the project.

result.title: ROTATE's website
result.description: Official web page of the project, including description of the WP, leader role, partners, outputs, deliverables and actual updates (T7.2).

details.authors: Asbjörnsson, Gauti; Sköld, Adam; Zougari, Sadeq; Yar, Ann-Gaelle; Kamel, Nemer; Turlur-Chabanon, Sophie; Bhadani, Kanishk; Gowda, Varun; Lee, Christina; Hulthén, Erik; Evertsson, Magnus

result.title: Communication with policy makers & public bodies
result.description: Report based on fair and transparent communication requirements:1) environmental & circularity legal requirements applicable to M&Q: EU requirements will be taken as a reference. National, regional and local requirements will only be considered for each pilot site. ROTATE will establish threshold values for each site as reference for the indicators; 2) indicators, trends and levels in each one: based on standards UNE 22480:2019 Sustainable M&Q- mineral processing- metallurgy management system. Requirements, and UNE 22470:2019 Indicators, the development of an EU standard will be proposed. EU Principles for sustainable RM approved in 2021 by DG Grow will be used as reference for ethics and transparency (T5.7).

result.title: Valorisation of Aggregate-Washing Sludges in Innovative Applications in Construction

details.authors: Yury Villagran-Zaccardi, Francisca Carreño, Line Granheim, Antonio Espín de Gea, Ulf Smith Minke, Stefania Butera, Elena López-Martínez, Arne Peys
Gauti Asbjörnsson, Adam Sköld, Sadeq Zougari, Ann-Gaelle Yar, Nemer Kamel, Sophie Turlur-Chabanon, Kanishk Bhadani, Varun Gowda, Christina Lee, Erik Hulthén, Magnus Evertsson

result.title: Sustainability Assessment of Celestine Production and Tailings Enrichment with Flexible Circuits

details.authors: Varun Gowda, Kanishk Bhadani, Gauti Asbjörnsson, Francisco Ortega, Noemi Ariza-Rodríguez, Diego Mesa, Pablo R. Brito-Parada, Magnus Evertsson
details.journalTitle: Mineral Processing and Extractive Metallurgy Review

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
